critique: The document is an executive order from 1942 during World War II, authorizing the Secretary of War to take possession and operate a private company (S.A. Woods Machine Company) to produce war materials. This was done to ensure the company met its contracts with the US government and contributed to the war effort. The order also specifies the employment of necessary personnel, including an advisor on industrial relations, and allows the Secretary of War to exercise the company's rights or take necessary steps. The order would be terminated when the President determined the plant would be privately operated in a manner consistent with the war effort.
